name: Vitamin E capsule
description: Vitamin E is another nutrient that's good for the skin, and many natural beauty products use vitamin E oil to treat dark circles, but it's important not to apply undiluted oil directly to the skin because some people are allergic to it.

name: Cinnamon
description: Cinnamon has the ability to kill microorganisms that cause the redness and pus associated with acne. Cinnamon's anti-inflammatory qualities help to alleviate pimple swelling and redness.

name: Aloe Vera
description: Soothing gel with anti-inflammatory and moisturizing properties.

name: Fuller's Earth
description: Fuller’s earth is a safe and relatively inexpensive way to cleanse your skin and improve your skin’s appearance, especially if you have oily skin and treat acne.

name: Sandalwood powder
description: Sandalwood powder has anti-bacterial properties and rich antioxidant content which help in the healing of many diseases related to the skin easily without causing any side effects to the body.

name: Green tea
description: Green tea is rich in catechins, which are potent antioxidants that boost your immunity, skin health, reduce white heads and overall well-being.

name: Olive Oil
description: Olive Oil for face can be used as a natural moisturizer as it contains essential fatty acids.

name: Oatmeal and Banana
description: The coarse texture of the oatmeal and the smoothness of banana combine brilliantly to work wonders for your skin. It is not just a hair removing solution but also an excellent exfoliating mixture. It is the panacea for all facial hair problems.

name: Cornstarch
description: Cornstarch helps in getting rid of skin impurities and prevents breakouts.

name: Raw Papaya
description: Papayas hold skin brightening properties that help take away tan lines and dullness. This will act like an astringent and help reduce the appearance of the tan.
